intro: Stephanodaphne pilosa, commonly known as the hairy stephanodaphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a Mediterranean climate with dry summers. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces woody pods that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
